Posts.Content: ladybugmommy2010 wrote: Okay so here is my update. Today I went to the surgeon who my mom had already warned me about but I wanted a woman surgeon so I sucked it up and just went with her. She said she didn't feel any lumps which of course I know but I am in pain on one side of my body and sharp pains going through my left breast. She also said that it's hormonal changes maybe and it happens to 30 and 40 year olds, I am 25. I am going for the BRCA testing Thursday because of my family's high breast cancer history especially on my dad;s side. I am just really hurt,confused and worried. I truly dislike how young women my age are treated. It's like they feel like women under 40 can not have breast cancer. I do not want it but I want to know what's wrong. I am the type of person who hardly ever goes to the hospital or doctor and when I go I have to really think something is wrong. My sister goes to the hospital every week it seems and she has the most negative things to say. My only support system is my aunt because she knows how serious it. Thanks for listening. 29 years old with a 7 year old Family History: Paternal Great Grandmother, Paternal Great Aunt, Paternal Aunts. Sister, Maternal Aunt Surgery Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I just don't know! ladybugmommy2010 ladybugmommy2010

Posts.Content: ladybugmommy2010 wrote: I'm just a bit worried. Back information I had a breast reduction May 31st. So about 3 weeks ago I'm sitting down folding clothes and felt something leaking. Looked down and it was my nipple,clear discharge. So I'm like okay maybe it's from surgery or something. Well last week I squeezed and it was like a milky discharge. I let my gyno know about it and she wants to check it out. Any experience with anything like this?
